channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Brazil's top court orders nationwide suspension of Elon Musk's X
item.description: Brazil’s supreme court on Friday ordered a nationwide suspension of Elon Musk’s social network X after the company vowed to defy earlier court orders.

item.title: Warren Buffett leads Berkshire Hathaway to new heights at age 94
item.description: "It's been a matter of a well thought out strategy prosecuted for seven decades with discipline, consistency, and unusual insight," Oaktree's Howard Marks said.

item.title: European stocks end August at record high after volatile start to the month
item.description: European markets closed higher on Friday, the last trading day of August, as investors weighed key inflation data from across the region.

item.title: Alibaba shares rise after it completes three-year regulatory overhaul
item.description: Alibaba has completed a three-year regulatory "rectification" process after an antitrust fine it received in 2021, China's market regulator said Friday.

item.title: Where are low-cost airlines cutting back now? New planes
item.description: Some discount and low-cost airlines are looking to put off big expenses on

item.title: Euro zone inflation falls to 3-year low of 2.2%, backing September rate cut case
item.description: Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a decline to 2.2% in August, down from 2.6% in July.

item.title: This 29-year-old from one of London's poorest neighborhoods became a millionaire after selling his influencer marketing firm
item.description: Timothy Armoo grew up poor on a council estate in South London. Here's how he became a millionaire before the age of 30.

item.title: China's robotaxi push sparks job loss fears among drivers. Experts say it can create new jobs too
item.description: Experts say that new technology often displaces jobs when it enters the market, but it can also create new jobs.

item.title: Harvard-trained psychologist: 9 phrases people in healthy, thriving relationships don’t say
item.description: Harvard-trained psychologist Dr. Cortney Warren shares the hallmarks of a healthy, thriving and interdependent romantic relationship.

item.title: The Bank of Japan is certain to raise rates further. The question is when
item.description: BOJ is widely seen to stick to its monetary policy tightening campaign, but many markets participants remain divided over the timing of the next hike.

item.title: Intel working with bankers to present board with strategic options, sending shares up 10%
item.description: The advisors are likely to present their findings to Intel's full board in September, with a variety of options including M&A on the table.

item.title: You can buy mansions in these Mediterranean countries for the price of a studio in New York
item.description: Manhattan real estate is notoriously expensive. You can trade in your 500 sq ft condo in the city for a 7,000 sq ft home in Sicily, according to My Dolce Casa.

item.title: Intel CEO Gelsinger says he respects 'skepticism' from investors as chipmaker's struggles persist
item.description: CEO Pat Gelsinger acknowledged investors' concerns about the chipmaker at an event on Thursday.

item.title: Here’s how much athletes at the Paris Paralympics earn for winning medals
item.description: While the International Paralympic Committee does not dole out prize money for winning medals, several countries do reward their athletes with medal bonuses.

item.title: China’s Zeekr targets global markets with its electric SUV, priced to undercut Tesla’s Model Y
item.description: China's electric vehicle company, Zeekr, announced Friday that it will launch its first SUV in China on Sep. 20, starting at US$33,700, to compete with Tesla.

item.title: Musk ramps up attacks on Brazil’s top judge as X faces possible suspension, Starlink finances frozen
item.description: Brazil's highest court continues to clash with Elon Musk over content moderation on X.

item.title: Spain will pay digital nomads and remote workers in tech up to $17,000 to move to a rural region: Here’s what to know
item.description: The Spanish region of Extremadura is offering up to 200 digital nomads and remote workers as much as $16,703 in grants to relocate there for at least two years.

item.title: Japan's next prime minister could be the youngest candidate in a crowded election for party leadership
item.description: Shinjiro Koizumi surfed and ate sashimi in Fukushima to quell water safety concerns. He was also the first sitting cabinet minister to take paternity leave.

item.title: ‘Vigorous give and take’: U.S. security advisor discusses economic curbs in rare trip to China
item.description: U.S. national security advisor Jake Sullivan said he raised concerns about the country's focus on economic security in meetings with Chinese officials.

item.title: Dell beats estimates as server sales soar 80%, riding AI wave
item.description: Dell said it recorded $3.1 billion of AI server sales in the quarter, up from $1.7 billion in the May quarter.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: A tale of tier 2 cities
item.description: India's economic map is being redrawn.

item.title: China's electric car race is becoming more about chip prowess as companies focus on tech
item.description: Price wars aside, Chinese electric car companies are now competing on driver-assist and other tech powered by semiconductors.

item.title: Affirm shares have best day in three years, surge 32% after earnings beat
item.description: Affirm shares soared Thursday after the provider of buy now, pay later loans reported better-than-expected quarterly results.

item.title: Lululemon cuts guidance, misses sales estimates after botched product launch
item.description: Lululemon's growth in its largest market, the Americas, has slowed from the highs it saw last year as it contends with product rollout challenges.

item.title: German inflation posts surprise drop to 2% in August
item.description: The harmonzied German consumer price index eased to 2% in August, the statistics office Destatis said Thursday.

item.title: Nvidia shares fall despite earnings beating estimates
item.description: Nvidia shares fell on Thursday despite its fiscal second-quarter results beating estimates.

item.title: Uber takes stake in SoftBank-backed self-driving tech startup Wayve
item.description: Uber and British artificial intelligence startup Wayve announced a partnership Thursday that will see the two collaborate on autonomous driving technology.

item.title: UN nuclear watchdog chief pushes back on Moscow’s calls for objectivity after Kursk plant visit
item.description: Russia accused Ukraine of attempting a drone strike at the Kursk nuclear plant during a lightning cross-border incursion under way since early August.

item.title: Trump punts on promise to deliver plan to make U.S. 'crypto capital of the planet'
item.description: Trump punts on his promise to lay out "a plan to ensure the United States will be the crypto capital of the planet" on Thursday.

item.title: Delivery Hero shares pop 10% as European food delivery giant plans IPO of Middle East unit
item.description: Delivery Hero CEO Niklas Ostberg said the IPO of its Middle East business was about bringing in local investors in the region to co-invest and support the unit.
